programmes.show_description: July 1987, Carlsbad, New Mexico, Donna Hyatt's daughter returns home to find her mother brutally murdered. She has been beaten, sexually assaulted and strangled to death. S4, Ep5
2003, a man walking his dog in Mammoth Lakes in California's Sierra Nevada mountains finds a human skull. Despite law enforcement's best efforts, they cannot identify the woman's remains. S4, Ep6
When Angela Prichard was terrorised by her husband, she turned to the police for help. Prichard called repeatedly as he stalked, harassed and threatened her. S37, Ep23
When a mother of three vanishes after a 1986 blizzard, Connecticut police are led to a chilling theory when the trail of evidence finds them on the shores of an icy lake. S2, Ep13
...Accident? The case of Cody Johnson, who was pushed to his death almost 200 feet into a ravine at Glacier National Park, by his wife of only eight days, Jordan Graham. S1, Ep7
Series presented by Nick Knowles which shows the split-second moments when everyday events are transformed into disasters and meets the people who lived to tell the tale. S4, Ep8/20
Series presented by Nick Knowles which shows the split-second moments when everyday events are transformed into disasters and meets the people who lived to tell the tale. S4, Ep9/20
Series presented by Nick Knowles which shows the split-second moments when everyday events are transformed into disasters and meets the people who lived to tell the tale. S4, Ep10/20
Series presented by Nick Knowles which shows the split-second moments when everyday events are transformed into disasters and meets the people who lived to tell the tale. S4, Ep11/20
Innovative, value-for-money products brought directly to you at home. Shop 'til you drop whilst avoiding the hustle and bustle of the High Street.
A five-year-old child recovering from a tonsillectomy is allegedly upset by his mother's behaviour; she denies all vandalism charges. S21, Ep172
Stolen property, 'door wiggling', and a fear of roaches come into play when two women fight over alleged vandalism. S21, Ep173
Ex-lovers fight over a trip to Italy after their young son gets sick, and the trip is called off. S21, Ep174
When a young mother tries to dictate custodial rights to the alleged father of her child, Judge Judy sets her straight. S21, Ep175
A car dealership owner defends against a wrongful repossession only to discover that his ex-partner may have been pocketing cash payments. S24, Ep117
A man accuses an upstanding businessman of damaging his beloved Mercury Grand Marquis while in the process of stealing the chrome off the vehicle. S24, Ep118
A mother claims her fear of homelessness led her to bust down a door and allegedly assault a tenant that was moving out. S24, Ep119
A woman with children who have special needs is shocked when her landlord allegedly spies on her and accuses her of dealing drugs. S24, Ep120
A young couple demand that their ex-friend pay them back for rent; he countersues for eviction costs after their friend was involved in a shooting. S18, Ep168
A man whose hobby is caring for horses, goats and dogs, is sued for a false arrest, an assault and threats of bodily harm by his neighbour. S18, Ep169
A woman accused of stealing her brother's personal injury money claims he owed her thousands in rent; the Judge discovers that she overcharged him. S18, Ep170
A woman accuses the father of her child of not feeding her child; her remedy is to immediately file for a restraining order. S21, Ep207
An inconsiderate neighbour lets his large dog use a common area as a toilet; the German Shepherd bites the man who videotaped their negligence. S21, Ep208
While working together at a check cashing store, a woman claims the manager illegally repossessed her car; he says she was about to be fired. S21, Ep209
A restaurant server claims she was 'football tackled' by her roommate because she was ignoring her during an argument. S21, Ep210
When a woman allegedly spins her car and sprays rocks at her estranged lover, he is accused of firing back with a handful of rocks. S21, Ep211
An experiment in living together fails miserably when a pregnant young woman sues her ex-boyfriend for $4,000 in moving costs. S21, Ep212
A man is short on money to pay rent and a security deposit, so he offers up the use of his car; his roommate says that never happened. S21, Ep213
Shards of glass from a broken window lead a haemophiliac to fear for his life and file a restraining order against a fellow tenant. S24, Ep133
A flatbed driver accuses his boss of stealing over $2,000 from his paycheck to cover repairs after he has an accident. S24, Ep134
A woman cites friends and neighbours as witnesses to her ex-coworker's alleged violence, but none of them show up in court. S24, Ep135
A mother of three fails to report income and loses her Section 8 status prompting her landlord to kick her out; her 'guarantor' father refuses to pay up as promised. S24, Ep136
In 2017, Ellen Higginbottom was murdered by Mark Buckley in Orrell Water Park, Wigan. After fleeing the scene with her laptop and phone, Buckley was caught by police. S1, Ep4
David Pearce, is awaiting sentencing after he was found guilty of murdering two young women and sexually assaulting seven others. S37, Ep24
A toddler tragically dies after being left inside his family's vehicle on a hot summer day in Atlanta, Georgia. S2, Ep14
Serial killer and rapist Stephen Port used a number of dating sites to lure four young men to his flat in Barking, where he poisoned them with lethal doses of date-rape drug GBH. S1, Ep1
On the 16th of December in 1988, the tranquillity of smalltown life is shattered forever when the body of a woman is found by a group of road workers on the interstate. S4, Ep7
In Sierra Nevada, 1977, a horseback ride turns into a nightmare when a group of riders discover a woman's dead body, discarded amongst the scenery. S4, Ep8
David Pearce, is awaiting sentencing after he was found guilty of murdering two young women and sexually assaulting seven others. S37, Ep24
A toddler tragically dies after being left inside his family's vehicle on a hot summer day in Atlanta, Georgia. S2, Ep14

Innovative, value-for-money products brought directly to you at home. Shop 'til you drop whilst avoiding the hustle and bustle of the High Street.
Dodger', the spaniel mix, is at the centre of a custody battle between his owners and the family that cared for him while they were unable to. S21, Ep189
Threats of wage garnishment, a guilty plea in an auto accident, and alleged auto theft come into play when a mother sues her son. S21, Ep190
A self-proclaimed nosy neighbour cares for a woman's Great Dane and is accused of spaying her unnecessarily. S21, Ep191
A woman grieves her loss of musical enjoyment when her violin teacher allegedly sells her a subpar violin. S21, Ep192
Punchy reality show about a female judge that has made a real impact on the American justice system. Judge Judy is real, honest and keen to get to the bottom of emotional cases. S24, Ep121
A newlywed sues a bridal-shop owner for delivering an allegedly damaged, custom-made wedding gown. S24, Ep122
A teenager insists that she took out a restraining on her ex-girlfriend, but her ex-roommate claims they are still dating and sues her for moving costs. S24, Ep123
After serving time, a young man must find a safe place to live. Instead, he is kicked out and accused of being disrespectful. S24, Ep124
A young boy is asked to leave the courtroom before things heat up in a case involving a mother protesting her son's lockout after a three-day tenancy. S18, Ep171
In an effort to regain custody of her child, a woman enters a sober living facility where she is accused of failing a drug test after a trip to see the Price Is Right. S18, Ep172
A woman denies stripping a mobile home clean when she left and is sued for property damage; she admits to accidentally starting a fire in the kitchen. S18, Ep173
A homeowner is horrified to discover that his prized trees have been completely cut down instead of just trimmed; the Judge gets to the root of the problem. S21, Ep214
Grandparents sue the father of their grandchild for an unpaid loan for lawyer fees used to dispute child custody with their own daughter. S21, Ep215
A litany of alleged hardships come to light when a man sues his ex-girlfriend for car damage and for breaking a lease. S21, Ep216
A woman claims she caught her boyfriend at a hotel with another woman and submits video evidence of him allegedly trying to break into her house. S21, Ep217
A woman files for a restraining order against her boyfriend after he allegedly throws a boot at her and bruises her. S21, Ep218
A woman sues her deceased grandson's former fianc√©e for the cost of a headstone after a $10,000 life insurance pay-out. S21, Ep219
A defendant is ill-prepared for questions from the Judge when she is sued by her ex-roommate for a security deposit. S21, Ep220
A pregnant woman accuses her brother of stranding her in Maryland while she was working for his trucking business; both want to stop the drama. S24, Ep137
A midwife makes the hard call to stay with a client whose baby just died instead of attending to a woman just beginning a difficult labour. S24, Ep138
A woman's jealous rage leads to a computer allegedly being thrown across the room and a cellphone being crushed. S24, Ep139
A couple move in with mum to improve credit scores and save for a new home; unfortunately, a fight over money and tools divide them. S24, Ep140
A woman is unaware that the home she inherited from her father has a $400k outstanding loan on it and is in danger of being foreclosed. S24, Ep1
While a woman is watching TV, her Husky allegedly escapes the home, enters a neighbour's house and mauls his kitten. S24, Ep2
A property owner blames her delinquency in pursuing ex-tenants for damages on her grave health issues and major surgery. S24, Ep3
A baseball coach faces time in prison or huge fines after a DUI charge; one of his player's parents bails him out. S24, Ep4
The Judge shares a phrase that her husband has not been able to utter. S24, Ep5
After a heated argument with his 34-year-old son, a man allegedly backs out of an agreement to help his ex. S24, Ep6
When asked to produce receipts for property damage, a man asks for the Judge's patience due to his loss of a relative in a mass shooting. S24, Ep7
A woman sues a cement mason for mistakenly tearing up her driveway; the mason claims he was a victim of a 'jack-hammering scam'. S24, Ep8
Before coming to court, a man receives a ruling that bars him entry to his own home; he accuses his ex-lover of lying and stealing. S24, Ep9
A daughter is outraged that her mother called authorities to perform a welfare check on her four children; the Judge sets her straight. S24, Ep10
